jobDescription: Duties:Assist in developing and implementing administrative policies and procedures for assigned coding areas of responsibilities.Reviews, analyzes, and interprets administrative directives and policies issued by the organization.Provides advice and assistance to management on coding manpower, personnel management matters, travel, training, performance appraisals, awards, surveys, and special studies.Utilizes extensive knowledge of the organization’s resource, program objectives, and applicable regulations, guidelines, directives, principles, and practices to monitor, and maintain efficient and effective training programs.Reviews codes assigned to parties automatically and manually for accuracy and linkages to other previously assigned codes, as well as parties with newly created codes to determine if they are subject to existing enforcement screens.Provides programmatic support to ensure that agency achieves organizational goals in the timeliest and cost effective manner (i.e., including but not limited to information management, personnel management, budget, and other managerial duties as assigned.)Reviews foreign entities to ensure their authenticity, legitimacy, and location.Minimum/ Required QualificationsBS/BA degree (or equivalent) related to Business, Finance and/or International Relations.Degree equivalent is 4 years of relevant work experience.Minimum of six (6) years of relevant experience in addition to degree or degree equivalent.Demonstrate mastery of spelling and grammar skills, and database management.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.Extended knowledge with computer tools common to business community such as, business registrations, database management, internet searching, and others.Ability to type 60 words per minute.Exceptional communication skills in the English language both orally and in writing.
